# beget_ssh_key (Resource)

SSH public key resource. Manages SSH keys for secure authentication to compute instances.

## Public Key Behavior

The `public_key` field is write-once:

- **On create**: Provide `public_key` to register a new key
- **On read**: API does not return `public_key` value (field remains in state from configuration)
- **On import**: Omit `public_key` from configuration to avoid one-time state update warning

The `fingerprint` is automatically computed from `public_key` and used for key identification.

## Example Usage
```terraform
# Create SSH key for compute instance authentication
resource "beget_ssh_key" "main" {
  name       = "my-key"
  public_key = "ssh-ed25519 AAAAC3NzaC1lZDI1NTE5AAAAIOw9mSAEkEDdWJbFMyRYz78HhT4qeZtTJRTQjgsCBoFv user@example.com"
}

output "ssh_key" {
  value = {
    id          = beget_ssh_key.main.id
    name        = beget_ssh_key.main.name
    fingerprint = beget_ssh_key.main.fingerprint
  }
}
```
<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) SSH key name. Changing this field will recreate the key resource

### Optional

- `public_key` (String) SSH public key content in OpenSSH format (e.g., 'ssh-rsa AAAAB3...'). Write-once field: API does not return it on read

### Read-Only

- `fingerprint` (String) SSH key fingerprint. Automatically computed from the public key content
- `id` (String) SSH key resource identifier. Automatically assigned when the key is created
